glsa.title: GIMP: Multiple integer overflows
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GIMP, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: GIMP is the GNU Image Manipulation Program.

description.p: Sean Larsson from iDefense Labs discovered multiple integer overflows in various GIMP plugins (CVE-2006-4519). Stefan Cornelius from Secunia Research discovered an integer overflow in the seek_to_and_unpack_pixeldata() function when processing PSD files (CVE-2007-2949).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running GIMP.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
